title: General
stimulusHtml:
2 points

1 point per item. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each item. Minimal Latin bolded. Two possible answers:

  • Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit (Great gods, bring it about that she be able to promise truly)

  • atque id sincere dicat et ex animo (and that she say it sincerely and from the heart)

In the second answer, either sincere dicat or dicat ex animo is sufficient. The request that the gods cause this to happen must be expressed or clearly implied at least once in the response.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 points

1 point per item. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each item. Minimal Latin bolded. Two possible answers:

  • Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit (Great gods, bring it about that she be able to promise truly)

  • atque id sincere dicat et ex animo (and that she say it sincerely and from the heart)

In the second answer, either sincere dicat or dicat ex animo is sufficient. The request that the gods cause this to happen must be expressed or clearly implied at least once in the response.

The student response earns one of the following points:

2 points

1 point per item. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each item. Minimal Latin bolded. Two possible answers:

  • Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit (Great gods, bring it about that she be able to promise truly)

  • atque id sincere dicat et ex animo (and that she say it sincerely and from the heart)

In the second answer, either sincere dicat or dicat ex animo is sufficient. The request that the gods cause this to happen must be expressed or clearly implied at least once in the response.

The student response earns all of the following points:

2 points

1 point per item. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each item. Minimal Latin bolded. Two possible answers:

  • Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit (Great gods, bring it about that she be able to promise truly)

  • atque id sincere dicat et ex animo (and that she say it sincerely and from the heart)

In the second answer, either sincere dicat or dicat ex animo is sufficient. The request that the gods cause this to happen must be expressed or clearly implied at least once in the response.
